glsa.title: PyCrypto: Execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in PyCrypto might lead to the execution of arbitrary code when decrypting using ARC2.

background.p: PyCrypto is the Python Cryptography Toolkit.

description.p: Mike Wiacek of the Google Security Team reported a buffer overflow in the ARC2 module when processing a large ARC2 key length.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to decrypt an ARC2 stream in an application using PyCrypto, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PyCrypto users should upgrade to the latest version:
